content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks in Markdown
    # A code block starts with `\n```julia` and ends with `\n````
    # There can be multiple code blocks, so we need to capture all of them
    pattern = r"(?s)\n```julia(.*?)```"

    # Use a capturing group to keep the content within the code block
    code_blocks = matchall(pattern, md)

    # If there are no matches, return an empty string
    if length(code_blocks) == 0
        return ""
    end

    # Join all the captured code blocks together with a newline
    joined_code = join([block[1] for block in code_blocks]) * "\n"

    # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the joined code
    trimmed_code = replace(joined_code, r"^\s+|\s+$" => "")

    return trimmed_code
end
```
